column4: Gnome has actually been getting faster with each release for a while
I would go with Hardy
I just used the 5.04 cd
Why not download and burn Hardy?
If that does not work 5.04 -> 5.10 -> 8.04 may be safer
yeah, but I have 8.04 cd to install from if it doesn't work
I doubt it will work :), you do know about the alternate install CD, correct?
yeah, but I don't have a working burner. I can use the live cd if I have to, I just expect it to be slow. I just built this pc from parts I had in a box. I'm surprised it turned on
If you do use the LiveCD keep the swap partition ( don't reformat it ), the LiveCD will make use of it automatically ( IIRC ) which should help
oh really? I didn't know that. I should have just done a reinstall from live then. I just dread live cd's on really old computers.
If you'
... If you'd like to talk with the channel ops join #ubuntu-ops.
thanks!
You're welcome.
now that you mention that, someone told me that recently, and I forgot I had even asked.
Waves: Do not use "-d", that's for development versions.
thanks for the tip!
Any of your primary partition slots (even all of them) can be used as extended partitions. It just doesn't make much sense to do so as you lose flexibility and gain nothing.
wikipedia entry on mbr disagrees.   en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disk_partitioning#PC_partition_types
I stand corrected then. Thanks.
np. I just learned that too
